Description: Rectangular mudstone cosmetic-palette with concave edges at the short ends. All four corners are drilled with 3 round hollows, possibly meant for inlay.
Bibliographic references: Brunton & Caton-Thompson 1928 / The Badarian Civilisation and Predynastic Remains near Badari (p, 31, pl. xx1. 11; xxvi.1)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
